meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, I had to rewetting the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally spilled water on the table, so I had to rewetting the cloth to clean it up.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the water bowl, rewetting the floor and causing a slippery mess.
meanings.sent4: The sudden downpour rewetting the dry earth, bringing new life to the parched land.
meanings.sent5: She carefully rewetting the sponge before wiping down the kitchen counter.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming wet again.
meanings.sent1: The rewetting of the clothes left them damp and uncomfortable to wear.
meanings.sent2: The rewetting of the soil after the storm helped the plants grow strong and healthy.
meanings.sent3: The rewetting of the paint caused the colors to blend together in a beautiful, unexpected way.
meanings.sent4: The rewetting of the riverbanks signaled the start of the rainy season.
meanings.sent5: The rewetting of the sponge made it soft and ready to absorb spills.
